item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ganesh.guddu, post:29, topic:159336”]use of BIPUSH(byte b) works fine to push any byte value . if i have to push a string onto the stack. for this i will have to use LDC(index i). could anybody tell me how to use this by an example ?? let us take the same example which is given in tutorial but the field being inserted is string type.

Thanks [/quote]

I am just taking this from memory, but I think it would be along the lines of:

int idx = constantPool.addString("some value", "some name");
instructionList.append(new LDC(idx));

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial
item.dc:creator: @lolcake lolcake_
item.description:
@lolcake wrote:

@ganesh.guddu, lookup javaagents. java.lang.instrument. create a javaagent that instruments every method with a code attribute (i.e. has ‘bytecode’) to add a println containing the class name and method name and argument values if you need help making the println, InstructionFactory comes with a nice createPrintln() method

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

If sL likes it, it must be good.
And yeah, “instruction” != “opcode”.
See, “bipush” is an instruction, 16 (0x10) is an opcode.

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

For once, I’m not in a flaming mood, so I’ll point out the errors I saw in your tutorial in a constructive way. You often mix up “Opcode” with “instruction”, e.g.

Right, as you can see, the place in which our integer is called has the Opcode “BIPUSH”.
An opcode is actually a byte identifying the instruction. Secondly, you described LDC2_W as an instruction for pushing a double from the constant pool. While that’s completely correct, it should be noted that a long is pushed using the same instruction. Beyond that, great job. I quite liked what I read of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“diddlewotsit, post:9, topic:159336”]This is imafatmess, I just changed my email on my normal account and I haven’t got the activation email back yet, so I’m posting with this…

Anyway, It is jbe and both jbe and CFParse are supplied on both the previous tutoirals in this series. Also, please don’t give me a Java cup, I don’t deserve one and I know I’m not as good at java as many other people, such as you _cake. I just took the time to write a tutorial about one thing that I am good at.

Anyway, I didn’t know that integers are only in the constant pool if past a certain value. I thought it was just floating point numbers. Anyway, yet another reason not to give me a java cup :P[/quote]
bullshit, you have patience, which many don’t, and are as good as anyone else here, so you deserve it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate BCEL tutorial

Anyway, It is jbe and both jbe and CFParse are supplied on both the previous tutoirals in this series. Also, please don’t give me a Java cup, I don’t deserve one and I know I’m not as good at java as many other people, such as you _cake. Anyway, I didn’t know that integers are only in the constant pool if past a certain value. I thought it was just floating point numbers. Anyway, yet another reason not to give me a java cup
